reviewText:
This ♥♥♥♥ing game...

Whilst the idea of pes online is really good, and can be fun, at times, the whole way the management/team building side of game has been executed, is terrible.

Pros -

-Football game and in my opinion better than Fifa 16
-Fun when it works
-The players everyone knows and love really do feel like your playing with the real life version, as opposed to fifa.
-Building your team and using certain players really has meaning
-Tackling is better than fifa
-Controls seem better than fifa.

Cons-

-1 single track in the game - ONE.
-Establishing connections
-The free agents randomly give you one player, that is generally really bad.
-Agents you can buy for 10000 coins randomly give you a player, so building your dream team is a bit of pot luck...
-Saving up coins is REALLY REALLY slow... if you can even save.
-Player contracts only last for 10 games and god forbid if you have a team of decent players, as the renewal cost is crippling and far outweights what you make from playing matches. 1 match will make you around 1000-1500 coins (but you'll probably have to renew one of your contracts, so you actually lose money)
- Your formation and playing style is dictated by the manager you have. If you have one manager with x formation, you cannot tinker it to how you like. You cannot make your own custom formations that you enjoy playing with. You are locked in the formation of the manager you have (although you can buy new managers...if you can save up the money LOLOLOLOL)
-Terrible goal keepers, who cannot save.
-Terrible AI
-Cheating AI
-Cheap losses
-Players who will lag you out to win
-Players who will quit the match forcing it to be void meaning you wasted a match contract for every player on your team.
-Being offside about a million times in a game.
-Being blatantly fouled and play not being stopped.
-Players never getting sent off. I've played 28 hours of this game now and i've not seen a single player be sent off.

The list goes on. This game is a bit of a p1ss take and the rewards you gain from playing are so low. I'd assume they set them low to force you into paying for the premium currency.
You'll find you get stuck in a loop of playing a game, making a minimal amount of money, usually renewing a contract of a player - losing you more money. This makes making any coins to build your team (which is completely random) a MUCH slower process - REVISED its seriously slow.
Also, it is entirely possible to not be able to play if you have released your terrible players and you have contracts up for renewal, but cannot afford to renew, and you dont have players to replace in your main squad....

EDIT: I played most of the night tonight. I started with 4000 coins and won about 70% of my matches. I have finished the night up now with just over 5000 coins. All the money I made was spent on contracts - My team has 8 black ball players. The cheapest renewal I have is 2300 - for 10 games. My R. Carlos renewal is at 3000 coins. I've not been able to buy any decent agents because all of my money goes on these damn contract renewals.
The money you earn and the coin sink for renewals is completely out of sync. It is 100% geared to pay to play/pay to win. The system really needs to be looked at, as the constant contract renewal really hinders the experience of trying to build your own team (Which you can't really do as the ball rewards are completely random)

The core game play is fun, if not frustrating - with players sometimes staring at the ball, running straight into the opposition, not passing in the direction you wish, but I personally prefer it to Fifa 2016.

I will still grind away at it though. If you want to go away with 1 word describing this game it is GRINDY. Really, really grindy.

The cons outweigh the pros for me. Im close to finishing playing this. I've always played more pes than fifa, but am a fan boy of neither. After more though I will probably be playing more fifa 16. Whilst the gameplay isn't quite that of pes, its team building, menu refinement and the fact that is isn't a terrible port, make it a better choice. It also isn't a terrible port, like the full version of pes2016 (which i wont be buying)

reviewText:
PES...Oh PES. A game with so much damn potential but with some issues here and there that cause quite a few problems from the collision detection to the goalkeepers. But the game does SO well in so many other parts such as the commentators, here's how fifa reacts to a goal. 'And he shoots...Oh and he scores!' Here's how PES reacts to a goal. 'AND IT'S MANDUSVIC'(However you spell his name) '...AND HE SCORES! ONLY 1 GOAL BETWEEN THEM, GAME ON!' So much energy it makes conceeding feel pressuring and scoring even more rewarding.

The Animations are also something of a key difference between PES and Fifa, Fifa lacks so much that PES offers, from the beautiful little touches to the lunging in, but of course this comes at a price due to the goalkeepers reacting to slow most of the time and conceeding easy goals.

How well does the game run? Well my laptop cannot run BF4 yet this game runs almost perfectly on lowest settings and it doesn't even look bad yet so if you have a poor machine then still give the game a try since it's free.

So is this like Fifa World? No, this actually is PES 2016 just with only My Club.

This or Ultimate Team? Well I've played UT for the past 5 or so years and the only 85+ player I've had is Suarez, after just starting the game and opening 1 special ball of my own and 1 FREE special Ball I got John Terry and Carlos (95 Pace, 95 Kicking Power)

Connection? Well I played an online game and the game lagged constantly, eventually, though I was winning, the game realised how bad the connection was and called the game off voiding everything instead of waiting for one our connections to give out and give the other person the win for having the better connection. This was probably down to me using WIFI or it was just our connection but I am glad I don't have to spend 20 more minutes hoping for the game to end.

Also the game gave me free Gold, EA doesn't know that word.

The MyClub feature also has training which improves your players and means you don't have to buy better players nessesarily.

The matchmaking also actually pairs you against players or your team level, so no Wayne Rooney and Sturridge up against Pele, Messi and Ronaldo with Bale and Neymar on Wings.

--Conclusion--
PES My Club is a brilliant free to play game that you should definitely try out. I can see PES becoming something great if Konami keep trying. Definitely try this out as it is a great game! I may actually buy PES 2016. Though I reccommend offline play against the computer unless you have luck playing online.

P.S. I hope for this to be on consoles and be a regular thing and not just a 1 time thing since this is what these games should be not £40 games with Microtransactions though unlike Fifa you can actually get good players...

The base idea is good. Let everyone play myclub so more people will get into it and pay for coins. If you play with others then there are the cheaters and the buggy useless defense.
Getting players, managers, renewing contracts and stuff are strictly designed so if you do not pay you will just get along. Basically one time contract extension gives 10 matches. This is around 500-700 gp for a lesser player (below 70). That means that I pay him 50-70 gp per match. I get around 1600-1800 after a victory, and only 600-800 after a defeat which means that if I do not win with this weak team then I would not be able to renew even their contracts, let alone the bigger players who need more than 2000 for a new contract. You can always say that when a game is free, there is no place for such harsh criticism, but when something is so grindy and has terribly bad connection like this one then it is not worth neither your money or time.

Pro Evolution Soccer 2016 myClub
Brief:  Pro Evolution Soccer 2016 myClub is a football simulation game developed by PES Productions and published in company with Konami Studios.

Signed as of Thursday, the Sixth of May, 2016 at 14:10 EST


The game itself is a daughter model of its mature, more fleshed out counterpart, Pro Evolution Soccer 2016. For the most part, the game is well thought out; despite having minor issues with graphical resolution sizes which can cause a lot of heart ache. As of exact, further complications on the games end haven't been revealed (yet) because of my diminutive hours played. The pros that I have collected are of a slightly higher quantity compared to the negatives. Firstly, it must be made clear that the personal reward and satisfaction gained is reasonably substantial, primarily due to the difficulty of the game. Scoring goals on your personal computer will never be as pleasant as PES 2016 myClub. Something else worthy of note is the game has a decent size player base. One could quickly search for a match in the multi-player feature, enter that lobby, then once it ends restart the process until bored. A straightforward endeavour, indeed. All in all, I would recommend this game for those interested in semi-competitive video games and soccer fanatics who want their casual (or so-so casual) recreational fix.

FINAL SCORE:  6.5/10

reviewText:
Firstly, I usually don't write reviews but I felt obliged to write this one because PES was a part of my childhood.
Since I first played PES 2006, this game has improved and changed a lot.
PES 2016 myClub has a lot of negative reviews which are mostly about bad connection and long loading times etc.
I personally haven't been DC-ed still and although loading after you enter anything is a bit annoying it isn't that bad I guess.

Graphics are ok,the players look great although for some reason very sweatty even though the match has only started.
Good thing is you can run this game with a potato-PC like mine.

Gameplay is good.After you score a goal you can select 4 celebrations whice is a nice feature.But I have to talk about goalkeepers who seem to have some sort of mental disorder.If you can get past the defence(which is not always that easy) you pretty much in 90% of the time will score because the GK seem to make only a few saves.Other than that the gameplay is pretty much what you can expect from a PES.

PES 2016 myClub is a bit different from the PES 2016 in the way its free(and that its pretty much something like FIFA World with the addition of vs COM matches).The manager(?) part of the game is fine.After every win you get a scout from which you can get a player.You also earn game funds which you can spend to buy scouts,coaches and etc.
All that is fine I guess.

So the sum up this game is not great its just fine so i'll give it a fine 6.5/10.

reviewText:
Now that I've had a good amount of time to play this game, here are some warnings:
Goalkeepers do not save like they do in FIFA. It is very easy to get scored on or to score, and you will go nuts at some of the goals that get scored on you. Try to make sure you have to use your keeper as little as possible, and make sure that getting a quality keeper is the first thing you do, because the keeper you start with will save NOTHING.
Defending is extremely difficult. Unless you double tap A, your defender may sometimes just walk PAST the ball instead of stealing it from the offense.
Waltzing. Players will sometimes dance around a ball instead of taking possession of it.
Only shoot from within the 18. You WILL score EVERY time. Otherwise, you always miss by a couple inches (unless you have Ronaldo or something).
The Team Strength brackets are somewhat broken. My team with an 88, 85, two 83s, and the rest mid 70s and some 60s was paired with a team full of 82+ players.
The best players are stupidly good. Oliver Kahn (Goalkeeper) will save everything, so once you score, just time waste. Ronaldo scores everything and always shoots at the right place.
There are a lot of people that are otherwise crap at the game but they have a better team than you (in Team Strength 3 and on) so prepare for that.
TIPS FOR NOOBS:
Don't hold down sprint. Also, when nearing an opponent on a 1v1 and he doesn't have anyone near him, double tap and hold the sprint button to his left or right. This will send the ball and your player past him.
Learn to use RT. It controls the ball so you have less stupid mistakes and other things happening.
Try not to hold down sprint when you're a defender trying to clear the ball. Sometimes this results in taking a BIG touch before clearing, which may result in the opposing team stealing it from you.
Use the secondary currency, the gold coins, to buy a good manager when you think you are ready. They are locked so you can only use that currency to buy them, and you get at most 700 of it from achievements (which gets you a really good manager).
~~~~~~~~~~~
It's not perfect, but it's definitely better than FIFA. I personally also believe that the MyClub feature is better than Ultimate Team in FIFA. Players level up like an RPG. Contracts are super simple: you just pay a certain amount to renew the contracts. It's easy to get really good players right off the start; there are so many achievements and there's usually a special promotion where you can spend 10000GP (not a lot) or 250 of the other currency (which you buy OR get through achievements) to get a guaranteed platinum player, and 70% chance platinum after that.
Finally, keep your cool. You will get seriously ♥♥♥♥♥♥ off.

reviewText:
- The delay
Do you want to intercept the ball with sliding? Forget about it. By the time your player slides, your opponent will have already scored.
- The FPS drops
Seriously, why? There has not been a single game where I didn't have these. It doesn't make it unplayable, but it certainly makes it unenjoyable.
- The random chances
So the players have classes (other than levels), black being the highest, gold second, etc... It has a chest-like system where you get a sweet suspense. Well, it's not much of a suspense because if you have a chest (!) with 70% of black ball and 30% of golden ball, chances are you'll get golden. There are a lot of people complaining about this.

So these were the cons. I wanted to write them beforehand because some of them might be big turn-offs for you. The pros;

- The players you get at the start of the game are absolutely terrible but it's easy to climb the ladder. Has a lot of features that makes you want to play even more in a way of MMORPG's did.

- The player base (at least at the start of the game) isn't terrible. You get a maximum 1,5 minute of waiting before it finds a match.

- Last but not least: It's freaking free. When I first saw this on Store, I couldn't believe my eyes. I was sure there was a catch. Other than micro-transactions (which you can buy with in-game currency as well) there's no catch!

If you got no problem with 5.5 GBs of data download and a 30-minute training, give it a shot.

reviewText:
In short, I don't see any point of playing impaired version of PES16 with the same microtransactions - if you willing to spend  a lot of money on this game why wouldn't you buy full game?

Also, I'd like to compare this game to FIFA World (sadly, terminated project) which also was FIFA limited to Ultimate Team mode.

The only advantage PES16 myClub edition has is that it is basically PES16 game, but only limited to myClub mode while FIFA world was FIFA15 Ultimate Mode implemented on the graphical engine of some football manager game. So, in terms of graphics PES surely wins, but this is their the first and the last point.

Only negative beyond this line:

- Most of the teams and player are not licensed, so your starting team will be made out of some made-up Uzbekistanian players. No fun. / FIFA has everything licensed
- Starting team is the same for every player, so you will be having a lot of mirror matches at the start. No fun. / FIFA offers 2nd - 4th division real players for starter.
- No Russian, Japanese (I wonder why Konami still couldn't get a licence for their national league) and North American leagues, only South American (Argentina, Chile, Brazil) which is also boring.
- Terrible contract/salary system which is the worst problem of the game: your players have contracts for limited number of matches, when contract expires you have to pay in-game money to renew the contract. Cost of contract renewal for 85+ rating player is ~2000 points, while you'll earn 2k points for 1 match won or 2-3 matches lost. Basically, you are limited to have weak team since you would be able to support small number of players and most likely won't be able to recruit more players. Your gameplay would be limited only to struggle to maintain all your existing players' contracts even if you're winning 100% of your games OR you may pay some real money. No fun.
In FIFA, there are booster packs which contain players, contracts, stadiums and other in-game stuff by a reasonable price. You never have problem of maintaining contracts, especially if you're winning most of the time.
- SIM matches are very slow for some reason and cannot be accelerated. Booooooring.
- You can't customize your team, only chose logo and stripe from already existing teams.

Overall: play PES2016 with mods or FIFA. This game is just boring.

reviewText:
Great game good value for money ohh wait... it is f2p!

Seriously, we have been waiting for a while to get a replacement after the FIFA world debacle, now of all games PES is the one that makes this move and I did not expect that!

Pros:
- You can customize all your controls
- Good match-up system ( you only play vs equally strong teams / it tries to match you up with the same skill level )
- It is free, yes you can get a better team by paying for more rng balls however you will never face people with a much stronger team and thus it is fairly balanced ( at least in the early stages )
- Games disconnect when there is too much lag between you and your opponent. And will be considered invalid.
- Will run on nearly any potato machine as it is a xbox 360/ps3 port. (however this is just as much a con)
- Defending / attacking are rewarding, if you make sure you run between a the passer and target the intercepts are 9/10 times happening regardless of player level (I think) on the contrary, if your through ball does succeed it is a big opener and hard to get back in defence. When you close gaps in the back it pays off.
- Goalkeepers are not gods that safe everything they are actually pretty poor making a big chance to score most of the time a goal.  So if you defeat a defence you do not have to worry about the GK rng as much.
- You can block players after each match, so if you play someone that is cheating/lagging/harassing. You can simply block them and do not have to worry of being matched up against them again. This encourages fair play, I really like this feature!


Cons:
- Input lag, when you play online there is input lag though in some matches it is slim to none. The majority of them however do have this.
- Game needs more players matchmaking can take a while.
- Outdated graphics due to reasons mentioned above, if you port something to PC it should in my opinion at least be up to par with the latest generation of consoles.
- Commentary in-game although it can be good from time to time most of the time it is fairly slow on responding to what happens on the pitch.
- Long connecting to server" / "testing your network" times

All and all it is a great game and I definitely suggest downloading it and giving it a shot. It leaves a lot to be desired

reviewText:
Well I haven't played PES games since the golden era, but i think it is a good game.

First when I started playing this game I was really mad, because I was loosing to players that I would wax in classic pes games, and the game speed is much slower then what I was used to in good old pes games.
However I cousin (that is PES guru) pointed one thing out, he told me. remember when we would play Master league and we had Castolo, Ruskin, El Moubarki, Lothar, remember how horrible it was to play with this players you would change directions and the players would take half an hour to respond. Well this is the same situation you are playing with week players so don't expect anything from them.
He was right, after i got decent squad pes started to feel more like the old pes games (still not as good) but i started to have fun and started win games.
The good about this game is that, it doesn't force you to pay money to but good player, yes having good players is a plus but yesterday I played against a team that had all the good players my team is level 2 and his was level 5 but I still won because he was rubbish, but I played with the weaker team and he wan because he was more skilled then I were.

However i have huge problem with GK in this game, and I should point out that if you play against a good GK they aren't as terrible as you first think, but still GK are awful in this game, it is like they aren't even there every shoot towards Soccer Net is a goal. Don't count that GK will ever do anything.

The second problem i have with this game is, auto defense just doesn't work, so if you want any defense out of your time you should do everything yourself. So no more pressing button help the defense somehow manages to form huge halls in the middle. In old PES games you could use smart tackling to strengthen your defense but in this game tackling is almost useless you press, you press tackle button and half year later player decides to do what you told him to do, but the play is already over everyone has moved on three goals have been scored and now he got a useless foul and a yellow card.

One part of the defense is that players just can't do things you tell them to do, for example the ball is in the air and it is time to play with a head, ok no one is near your player and you tell the game to give a pass to a player left of him. So what happens the players manages to miss his head and now you have one on one with the keeper. Or the ball is in the air and falling in the box, you tell the GK to rush out to grab the ball, so What happens the GK runs to a totally different side, and because you haw slow defender the FC scarred a goal.

Third the connection works like s!it, I played PES games online on PS2 and i think they are using the same code, ok it's not that bad but it's close. The game is always connecting to something, checking and testing connection. You've entered settings menu: well time to test, retest connection, establish connection, re establish connection, drop connection, test connection again and then finally show you the menu.

Four there is nosing social about this game, you cant add a friend, see any ones team. hell you can't even send a massage to anyone. I really want to compere my stats/team to my friends stats/teams but I can't.

So the this are the pros and cons in this game
Pros:
Winning feels nice.
Nicely balanced team building, you don't need to buy your way through to build a good team.
Low system requirements
Free
Decent graphics.

Cons:
Defenders can't even guard a graveyard
GK are worse then a log.
Player's can't execute your commands.
Bad net cod.
No social features.
